metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7306 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Byobu Apport hook may disclose sensitive information since it automatically uploads the local user's .screenrc which may contain private hostnames, usernames and passwords. This issue affects: byobu

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7306` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

byobu - 5.106-0ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: byobu package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.106-0ubuntu1+esm1').
